channel.title: Workstation turned off in the middle of a Tor Browser session
channel.description:
I was using Tor Browser within a Whonix Workstation, but then the program and the VM itself froze in the middle of what I was doing, so I had to turn off the machine. Does turning off the machine in the middle of a Tor Browsing session cause problems suck as IP Address leaks?
(Also, The host machine was never turned off and the Whonix Gateway was never turned off).
By the way, I'm actually the user Dgjhpbn2, but whenever I entered my password it said "incorrect password" -- I reset the password using my email, but after 5 attempts the email never arrived, thus meaning I am currently locked out of that account with no way to get back into it.

item.title: Workstation turned off in the middle of a Tor Browser session

item.description:
I was using Tor Browser within a Whonix Workstation, but then the program and the VM itself froze in the middle of what I was doing,
so I had to turn off the machine. Does turning off the machine in the
middle of a Tor Browsing session cause problems suck as IP Address
leaks?

no leaks

By the way, I’m actually the user Dgjhpbn2, but whenever I entered my
password it said “incorrect password” – I reset the password using my
email, but after 5 attempts the email never arrived, thus meaning I am
currently locked out of that account with no way to get back into it.

which email client u r using on that account ?

I was using Tor Browser within a Whonix Workstation, but then the program and the VM itself froze in the middle of what I was doing, so I had to turn off the machine. Does turning off the machine in the middle of a Tor Browsing session cause problems suck as IP Address leaks?

(Also, The host machine was never turned off and the Whonix Gateway was never turned off).
